text.front:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM
PRESENT
THE HONOURABLE MR.JUSTICE V.G.ARUN
THURSDAY, THE 28TH DAY OF JANUARY 2021 / 8TH MAGHA, 1942
Crl.MC.No.117 OF 2021(D)
CC 2388/2017 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS,
IRINJALAKUDA
CRIME NO.660/2017 OF Varandarapilly Police Station,
Thrissur
PETITIONER/S:
GITSON
AGED 30 YEARS
S/O. THOMAS, POARATHUKARAN HOUSE, MANNAMPETTA
DESOM, MANNAMPETTA P.O., AMBALLORE VILLAGE,
MUKUNDAPURAM TALUK, THRISSUR DISTRICT, PIN-680
302.
BY ADV. SRI.N.L.BITTO
RESPONDENT/S:
THE STATE OF KERALA
REPRESENTED BY THE SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE,
VARANTHARAPPILLY POLICE STATION REPRESENTED
THROUGH THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF
KERALA AT ERNAKULAM-682 031.
OTHER PRESENT:
SR.PP.C.S.HRITHWIK
THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR
ADMISSION ON 28.01.2021, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED
THE FOLLOWING:
text.body:
ORDER
Dated this the 28 th day of January, 2021
Petitioner is the accused in Crime No.660 of
2017 registered at the Varandarapilly Police
Station for the offence punishable under Section
27 of the NDPS Act, now pending as C.C.No.2388 of
2017 on the file of the Judicial First Class
Magistrate Court-I, Irinjalakuda.
2. According
to
the
prosecution,
the
petitioner along with 4 others were found smoking
ganja. Five partly burned beedies were seized
from the spot.
3. The petitioner is the Physical Education
Teacher in an aided school and consequent to
registration of the crime against him, has been
placed under suspension. The petitioner therefore
prays for expeditious disposal of the case.

4. In the report called for by this Court,
the learned Magistrate has stated that from
18.12.2019 onwards, the case was repeatedly
posted after recording plea of the accused, but
in view of the lock down restrictions and the
guidelines issued by the High Court, the case has
to be adjourned on notification and the next
posting is on 23.02.2021. That, on 18.12.2019,
summons has been ordered to CW1. It is report
that statements of only two witnesses have been
produced with the final report filed. According
to the learned Magistrate, two months time is
required to dispose the case.
In view of the report and the urgency
expressed by the petitioner, the Crl.M.C is
disposed of directing the Judicial First Class
Magistrate
Court-I,
Irinjalakkuda,
to
take
earnest efforts to dispose C.C.No.2388 of 2017

within an outer limit of three months from the
date of receipt of a copy of this order.
Sd/-
V.G.ARUN
JUDGE
Scl/28.01.2021
